intro: Oenanthe biebersteinii f. divaricata, commonly known as the silverleaf cow-wheat, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often divided, compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces a distinctive, slender fruit. The foliage has a silvery appearance due to dense, fine hairs covering the leaves.
